document.docAuthor: Filho, Léo Correia Da Rocha & Packer, Laurence
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Neotropical subgenera Coelioxys (Platycoelioxys) Mitchell and C. (Rhinocoelioxys) Mitchell (Hymenoptera; Megachilidae) with the description of one new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Neotropical subgenera Coelioxys (Platycoelioxys) Mitchell and C. (Rhinocoelioxys) Mitchell (Hymenoptera; Megachilidae) with the description of one new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Coelioxys excisa
Friese, 1921
: 447
. syn . nov .
Coelioxys crassiceps
Friese, 1921
: 475
. syn . nov .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Females of this species are easily recognizable by the triangular excision of the apical margin of the clypeus and the brownish erect setae that form tufts on the lateral sulci of T 6 . Within the subgenus, these two characteristics are found only in females of this species. Males of
C . agilis
can be distinguished from all the other C . ( Rhinocoelioxys ) by the shape of the apical margin of S 4 . Besides, the area which in other species forms a hypostomal concavity is flat and completely covered by erect white hairs while in other species of the subgenus the concavity is glabrous at least posteriorly.

Redescription. Female . ( LACM ). “ TRINIDAD & TOBAGO , Trinidad : Mt. St. Benedict, 10,67ºN
61.40 ºW
,
26 Nov. 1999
rainforest, coll. R. R. Snelling”. “ LACM ENT 317983 ”.

Measurements . Body length: 7.19 mm ; forewing length: 4.89 mm ; head width: 2.29 mm . Coloration . Black except as follows: Antenna, labrum, legs, sterna dark brown; tegula dark to light brown; wings subhyaline; veins dark brown to blackish.

Pubescence . Pale, subappressed on: Paraocular area, fringe on apical margin of clypeus posteriorly, gena, mandible basally, labrum, interrupted transverse fascia on anterior margin of mesoscutum, mesosoma, legs, basal fascia of T 1 , apical fasciae of sterna. Ocular hairs pale, long (about 0.12 mm ). Scattered erect, slender, white setae on paraocular area. Upper paraocular area with long, brown hairs distinct from those of adjacent regions, oriented mesad, apices of some hairs from each side almost meeting medially. Slender, erect, yellow setae arising from punctures of mesoscutum. Supraclypeal area, clypeus covered with minute, appressed brownish hairs. Clypeal lobes with fringe of thick, brown hairs. Thick, yellow setae on tarsi. T 2 –T 5 apical fasciae composed of appressed, plumose, whitish hairs. Lateral sulci of T 6 with short, erect, brown setae.

Surface sculpture . Ocellar area coarsely punctate; vertex, mesoscutum, mesepisternum moderately densely punctate, interspaces among punctures larger than puncture diameter; mesoscutellum coarsely punctate except longitudinal median ridge smooth, almost impunctate; axilla coarsely, densely punctate; T 1 moderately densely punctate, interspaces among punctures shining, larger than puncture diameter; pregradular areas of T 2 –T 5 moderately densely punctate, interspaces shining, smooth; postgradular areas of T 2 –T 5 shining, with sparse punctures forming transverse row with additional small punctures medioposteriorly, T 6 densely punctate, punctures very small, well separated, punctures denser apically; S 1 punctate; postgradular areas of S 2 –S 4 moderately densely punctate basally, more sparsely towards apex, postgradular area of S 5 less densely punctate basally, more densely punctate towards apex.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1 .
Coelioxys agilis
. Female ( A–D ): A . Lateral view, B . Frontal view of head, C . Dorsal view of mesoscutum and mesoscutellum, D . Lateral view of T6 and S6. Male ( E–I ): E . Lateral view, F . Lateral view of head and mesosoma, G . Dorsal view of T2 and T3, H . Dorsal view of T5 and T6, I . Ventral view of S4 and S5. (Scale bar = 1.5 mm).

subSubSection.paragraph: Structure . Apical margin of clypeus with small, triangular excision medially, forming two flat, slightly upwardly oriented, small lobes with acute apices. Mesoscutellum with posterior margin obtusely angulate, longitudinal median ridge present. Axilla long, acute. T 6 subacute apically, with small sulcus laterally. Dorsomedian line of T 6 obsolescent except forming sharp ridge apically with depressions lateral to the sharp ridge shallow, obsolescent. Apex of S 5 rounded. S 6 slender, elongate, lateral margins convergent apically, notches obsolete, tip subacute. Hemitergite 7 much longer than wide, area subtended by the marginal ridge narrow; apodemal region greatly produced anteriorly; lateral process reduced; spiracle close to apical margin of lamina spiracularis; lateral lamella wider than lamina spicularis. Dorsal arm of furcula long. Gonostylus subacute apically.

Male
. ( LACM ). “ Brasil , Para, 2. 1902 , Ducke”. “
Coelioxys excisa
, 1904 Friese det., Fr.”. “ LACM ENT 317985 ”.
Measurements . Body length: 6.67 mm ; forewing length: 4.69 mm ; head width: 2.08 mm . Coloration . As in female.

Pubescence . As in female except as follows: Face densely covered with pale hairs, hypostomal concavity covered with erect hairs. Apical pale fasciae of T 2 –T 5 broadly interrupted medially, gradular grooves of T 2 –T 6 covered with whitish hairs.

Integument . As in female except as follows: Punctures of mesoscutum larger; mesepisternum coarsely punctate; postgradular areas of T 2 and T 3 with inconspicuous, transverse, narrow punctate area on each side with some punctures fused; T 6 less densely punctate towards base, densely punctate laterally and on dorsomedian excavation, dorsal ridges impunctate; postgradular area of S 5 moderately densely punctate, interspaces among punctures shining, larger than the puncture diameter.

Structure . As in female except as follows: Hypostomal concavity shallow, discrete, shorter than half length of compound eye. Spine-like processes of T 5 completely fused to the surface of the tergum. Lateral processes of T 6 small, triangular, acute, divergent; dorsal processes short, narrow, rounded apically; ventral processes long, acute. Apical margin of T 7 semicircular, not strongly produced. Apical margin of S 4 bare medially, simple. Apical rim of S 4 inconspicuously emarginate, bare medially. Apical margin of S 5 simple, gradulus angulate towards base. Gradulus of S 6 indistinct but U-shaped, nearly reaching basal margin, pregradular areas narrow, elongate, weakly sclerotized on inner margins, strongly sclerotized along outer margins, narrowly acute at base, apical half of pregradular area densely setose, less setose on outer margins, postgradular area transparent medially, broad at base, basal membranous lip rounded. S 7 obsolescent, represented by two small sclerites. S 8 rounded basally. Gonocoxa compressed laterally, with some long setae apically, equal to penis valve in length.
Variation . In some specimens the legs and sterna are red to reddish.

Floral Records .
Cosmos caudatus Kunth
( Asteraceae ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2 . Distribution records for
Coelioxys agilis
.
